intro: Symplocos patazensis, commonly known as the Patazensis wax myrtle, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and mountainous regions. The fruit is a small, hard capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
